artistName: 上海绽放网络科技有限公司

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative and an excellent touch-screen control system, it’s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

editorialNotes.standard: This acclaimed platformer motivates you to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Deliver packages to rebuild a ravaged society – and unravel supernatural mysteries – in this wild post-apocalyptic adventure crafted by legendary game maker Hideo Kojima.

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, it’s too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Put an end to the terror

editorialNotes.standard: The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

So much more than a simple action game, Duet elevates the act of dodging falling blocks into something captivating, beautiful, even profound. A stirring soundtrack and striking visuals almost guarantee you’ll lose yourself in each stage, and as you learn the patterns and find yourself avoiding obstacles by sheer instinct, you’ll feel an overwhelming surge of triumph.
editorialNotes.short: Two vessels play out life’s duality.
Engage in dramatic mech warfare to protect mankind from invading monsters.
editorialNotes.standard: Booming with anime-style action, Implosion feels like it was forged in some techno-marvel future. Spectacular visuals and spellbinding music bolster an epic tale that pits you—one of Earth’s few survivors—against the monsters who stole our homeworld. Fighting in your War-Mech battle suit’s a blast, with legions of ghastly foes ready for your lethal sword and fearsome firepower. If you like games long on style and ambition, this one’s for you.

editorialNotes.tagline: A classic that never gets old

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Be the best zombie you can

editorialNotes.standard: Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axis’ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind, and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps, and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.

The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Classics never go out of style

editorialNotes.standard: This breakneck chapter in the Riptide GP series is so intense, it’s got us reaching for a life jacket. Or maybe several: Renegade’s solo campaign packs tons of water-racing events and sick tricks to master. (Split-screen local and eight-player online matches are our favorites.) However you play, stunning tracks like a gorgeous forest river deliver awesome arcade thrills. On Apple TV, it's our 2016 Game of the Year.
editorialNotes.short: Manage your speed and watch out for waves in this brilliant water-racing sequel.

editorialNotes.standard: Elegant but packed with personality, Zip Zap kept us happily tinkering for hours. To solve its deceptively tricky puzzles, you’ll set Rube Goldberg–style hinges and levers into motion with strategically timed taps. The bite-sized levels and one-finger controls make it perfect for quick escapes.
Dash between shadows and past nighmarish creatures in this gauntlet of intense stealth challenges.

There sure is a lot of debris in space. So if you want to survive as an intergalactic pilot, you’ll need to think fast. Thankfully, dodging and weaving through Hyperburner’s gorgeous levels is pure exhilaration. We love how beating stages “rewards” us with faster ships—it means the better we get, the harder the game gets.

Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: We haven’t seen hoverboarding this cool since the Back to the Future flicks. Oddrok’s fantastic action game lets you grind rails and shoot through half-pipes in levels stuffed with surprises. Rival boarders drop bombs in your path; towering sandworms and lethal lasers dare you to come near. The whole time, an energetic soundtrack and swooping camera give Power Hover an exhilarating, cinematic feel that’s like pure adrenaline.
Randomly generated levels keep every punishing platforming challenge fresh as you dash to save your kid.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Explore endless vertical worlds controlling a four-legged alien.

name: Cut the Rope: Time Travel GOLD

ios.subtitle: Om Nom goes to the past

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
